text: James Moran (6 March 1935 – 1 January 2020) was a Scottish footballer who scored 52 goals from 190 appearances in the Football League playing as an inside forward for Leicester City, Norwich City, Northampton Town, Darlington and Workington in the 1950s and 1960s. He began his career with Wishaw Juniors, and went on to play English non-league football in the Eastern Counties League for Lowestoft Town. In 1967, he joined Great Yarmouth Town, becoming manager for the 1968–69 season and leading the club to its first league title. He returned to Lowestoft, and later managed Gorleston from 1975 to 1976 and played for Bury Town, before becoming manager of Lowestoft. Moran died at the age of 84 in January 2020. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2020 deaths Category:People from Cleland, North Lanarkshire Category:Scottish footballers Category:Association football inside forwards Category:Wishaw Juniors F.C. players Category:Leicester City F.C. players Category:Norwich City F.C. players Category:Northampton Town F.C. players Category:Darlington F.C. players Category:Workington A.F.C. players Category:Lowestoft Town F.C. players Category:Great Yarmouth Town F.C. players Category:Gorleston F.C. players Category:Bury Town F.C. players Category:Scottish Junior Football Association players Category:English Football League players Category:Scottish football managers Category:Great Yarmouth Town F.C. managers Category:Gorleston F.C. managers Category:Lowestoft Town F.C. managers
title: Jimmy Moran
